newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania BIR bank plans to raise capital this year.
newsitem.headline: Romania BIR bank plans to raise capital this year.

text.p: Romanian private bank Banca Internationala a Religiilor (BIR) plans to nearly triple its share capital this year from 25 billion at end-1996, a bank official said on Tuesday.
"Our bank plans to raise capital to 75 billion lei by end-1997 through a share issue intended for its present holders," Valentin Daianu, assistent of BIR president, told Reuters.

BIR's gross profit rose to 25.2 billion lei last year from 15.3 billion in 1995, but its net profit slipped by about 1.9 billion lei to 8.76 billion as the bank paid profit tax for the first time last year, Daianu said.
The BIR, created in March 1994 and focusing on financing trade and agriculture, had a profit tax exemption till 1996.
"We will pay 83 percent dividends on shares in the leu and 10 percent for those denominated in hard currency," he said.

Daianu said BIR's main stockholders were Romanian investment company SIF Oltenia and companies in the Middle East and in Liechtenstein. None of them has more than 10 percent of the bank's capital, he added.
The bank plans to expand its network across Romania to 100 units this year from 35 at present, Daianu said. ($=6,974 lei)
